What are some key benefits and features of Verus reserve tokens and fractional reserve currencies on a PBaaS chain, and how do they differ from traditional cryptocurrency and historical human money?

Verus reserve tokens and fractional reserve currencies on a PBaaS (Public Blockchain as a Service) chain offer several innovative features and benefits that set them apart from traditional cryptocurrency and historical human money.

One key advantage is that Verus reserve tokens can be converted to the native coin of a PBaaS chain at any time without waiting for notarization and cross-chain transactions. This means that users can easily move their funds between chains and use them in a wallet, just like a native coin. Additionally, fractional reserve currencies can be sent back to the Verus chain and automatically converted to Verus along the way, providing flexibility and convenience.

Another important benefit is that Verus reserve tokens can be sent on a fractional_reserve blockchain without explicit conversion or Gas, preventing DoS attacks from flooding a chain with transactions. When sending Verus reserve tokens on a PBaaS reserve chain, network fees are automatically paid in Verus, which is converted on the fly to the native currency of the chain. This eliminates the need for additional conversion steps and makes transactions more efficient.

Verus fractional reserve currencies also offer decentralized capabilities and benefits that are new to both crypto and historical human money. For example, the Verus PBaaS protocol enables fully community-funded, fairly-launched reserve currency projects, corporate currencies, and more, which can all share liquidity with the rest of the Verus ecosystem. This means that liquidity is fully shared and grows as the network grows and is used, making the value of a currency less dependent on thin order books and more dependent on its fundamentally recognized value.
